item.title: Unlicensed HMO, 9th October
item.description:
13 Goulton Road is an unlicensed HMO, with multiple safety issues, including no fire escape because one exit is for the exclusive use of the renter leasing the living room. It is a 7 bedroom house that has a minimum of 8 renters at any given time.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goulton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess weeds 1’-2’ tall on pavements, debris and leaves in street, 9th October
item.description:
As a council tax payer I expect the council to keep the streets clean and uphold their duties for what they are taking money off us for. The street I live in at the top of cul de sac has not been swept properly so lots of debris, leafs are piled in the corners and along the curbstones furthermore the weeds have grown up in between the paving stones on the pavements and along the curbstones and in excess of foot tall . It looks an utter mess !! This is ongoing as it gets reported but a professional clean never takes place only a half bodge job .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mountview Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Adelaide Road, nr HS2 building works entrance, 9th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Chalk Farm, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 9th October
item.description:
Yet again, same place, same tree. Must have been dumped under the cover of dark, as it wasn't there 24hrs ago. You say, don't identify, but how are you going to stop this constant flytipping. In one of the photos, you will see a house that I know had plenty of rubbish in the front garden. And now after some years, their numerous wheelie bins, that use to sit on the pathway in front of the house, are now sitting in the garden, where rubbish was kept. It happens so often, you must have records on the amount of times I have had to be intouch. I know this will not be the last time I will be intouch. Until the next time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beddington Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unacceptable repair outside 23 Oakley Park, 9th October
item.description:
Yesterday 8/10/25 a very basic repair was done to the pavement outside 21-23 Oakley Park. There were a couple of cracked paving slabs but I certainly hadn’t asked for them to be repaired and the paving slabs have been replaced with a very basic lump of tarmac which looks absolutely terrible, out of keeping with the rest of the pavement and a real eyesore. By comparison at the same time and by the same people my neighbour at 19 Oakley Park had her cracked pavement slabs replaced by brand new paving slabs which look 100% better than the horrible lump of tarmac outside my house. Please can you explain who requested the repair and why have 2 houses only a few feet apart been treated so differently? I would like the tarmac outside 21-23 replaced with new pavement slab the same as my neighbour has been given. I have tried to upload photos to show you the huge difference in the 2 jobs but they won’t upload . Please let me have an email address so I can forward the photos on so you can understand what I am unhappy about. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Oakley Park, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
